p.bold: Selected books from this list will be reviewed in future issues.

body.p: Aspers, P. Orderly Fashion: A Sociology of Markets. Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 2010. 237 pp. $35.00 / £24.95, cloth; $35.00, eBook.
Baron, R. A. Entrepreneurship: An Evidence-based Guide. Northampton, MA: Edward Elgar, 2012. 227 pp. No price given.
Berebitsky, J. Sex and the Office: A History of Gender, Power, and Desire. New Haven, CT: Yale University Press, 2012. 359 pp. $38.00, cloth.
Berman, E. P. Creating the Market University: How Academic Science Became an Economic Engine. Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 2011. 265 pp. $35.00 / £24.95, cloth; $35.00, eBook.
Burton, R. M., B. Obel, and G. DeSanctis Organizational Design: A Step-by-step Approach. New York: Cambridge University Press, 2011. 258 pp. $99.00, hardback; $49.99, paper.
Colvin, R. A. Gay and Lesbian Cops: Diversity and Effective Policing. Boulder, CO: Lynne Rienner, 2012. 213 pp. $55.00, hardcover.
De Lange, D. E. Cliques and Capitalism: A Modern Networked Theory of the Firm. New York: Palgrave Macmillan, 2011. 256 pp. No price given.
Doellgast, V. Disintegrating Democracy at Work: Labor Unions and the Future of Good Jobs in the Service Economy. Ithaca, NY: Cornell University Press, 2012. 249 pp. $65.00, hardcover; $24.95, paper.
Frank, R. H. The Darwin Economy: Liberty, Competition, and the Common Good. Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 2011. 240 pp. $26.95 / £18.95, cloth; $26.95, eBook.

Hendrick, R. M. Managing the Fiscal Metropolis: The Financial Policies, Practices, and Health of Suburban Municipalities. Washington, DC: Georgetown University Press, 2011. 302 pp. $34.95 / £24.25, paper or eBook.
Hess, E. D. Grow to Greatness: Smart Growth for Entrepreneurial Businesses. Stanford, CA: Stanford University Press, 2012. 286 pp. No price given.
Krogerus, M., and R. Tschäppeler The Decision Book: 50 Models for Strategic Thinking. New York: W. W. Norton, 2012. 173 pp. $17.95, hardcover.
Kumar, R., and V. Worm International Negotiation in China and India: A Comparison of the Emerging Business Giants. New York: Palgrave Macmillan, 2011. 189 pp. $85.00, hardback.
McNeilly, M. R. Sun Tzu and the Art of Business: Six Strategic Principles for Managers, rev. ed. New York: Oxford University Press, 2012. 330 pp. No price given.
Prasad, A., ed. Against the Grain: Advances in Postcolonial Organization Studies. Copenhagen: Copenhagen Business School Press, 2012. 320 pp. $59.00, paper.
Shrivastava, P., and M. Statler Learning from the Global Financial Crisis: Creatively, Reliably, and Sustainably. Stanford, CA: Stanford University Press, 2012. 363 pp. No price given.

Smeeding, T. M., R. Erikson, and M. Jäntti, eds. Persistence, Privilege, and Parenting: The Comparative Study of Intergenerational Mobility. New York: Russell Sage Foundation, 2011. 379 pp. $49.95, paper.
Wasserman, N. The Founder’s Dilemmas: Anticipating and Avoiding the Pitfalls That Can Sink a Startup. Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 2012. 480 pp. $35.00 / £24.95, cloth; $35.00, eBook.
